intro: Micromeria filiformis var. rubrifolia, commonly known as the red-leaf micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the flowering plant family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, thread-like leaves and small, clustered white to pinkish flowers. Its varietal name, *rubrifolia*, refers to its distinctive reddish foliage, which becomes more prominent in autumn. This species is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
